desc: Put given files and directories into a vanilla ``ustar'' archive
Extract all files from a vanilla ``ustar'' archive
TQ   -e Encrypt given files and directories into an archive
TQ   -d Extract all files from an encrypted archive
TQ   -s Make a signed archive from the given files and directories
TQ   -t List the contents of the specified archive
TQ   -c Encrypt with a symmetric cipher using a passphrase
TQ   -r user Encrypt for user id user.  For details see gpg
TQ   -u user Use user as the key to sign with.   For details see gpg
TQ   -o file Write the archive to the specified file file
TQ   -v Enable extra informational output
TQ   -q Try to be as quiet as possible
Skip all crypto operations and create or extract vanilla ``ustar'' archives
Do not actually output the extracted files
TQ   -C dir Extract the files into the directory dir
TQ   -T file Take the file names to work from the file file; one file per line
Modify option --files-from to use a binary nul instead of a linefeed to separ…
Assume that the file names read by --files-from are UTF-8 encoded
This option has no effect because OpenPGP encryption and signing is the defau…
This option is reserved and shall not be used
Use batch mode.   Never ask but use the default action
Assume 'yes' on most questions
Assume 'no' on most questions.   This option is passed directly to gpg
This option is passed directly to gpg
Write special status strings to the file descriptor n
When extracting an encrypted tarball also write a log file with the gpg outpu…
Use the last component of file as the output directory
This option tells gpg to disable compression (i. e.  using option -z0)
Use the specified command gpgcmd instead of gpg
Pass the specified extra options to gpg
Assume args are standard options of the command tar and parse them
This is a dummy option for backward compatibility
Print version of the program and exit
Display a brief help page and exit.  EXAMPLES
